content: CPF SeedlyTV EP06 Retirement Asked by AnonymousAsked on 06 Jun 2019What happens when we dont hit our cpf full retirement sum by age 55? Will we still be getting payout? 2 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (2)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Zen Rogue XuanLevel 5. GeniusAnswered on 10 Jun 2019CPF Life provides you with monthly payouts for as long as you live. The amount you put in will determine how much you will be getting. If you do not hit the CPF Full Retirement Sum(FRS), you will be eligible to withdraw 5k, while the rest will be given in the form of monthly payout.0 comments0

Hariz Arthur Maloy, Independent Financial Advisor at Promiseland IndependentTop Contributor (Sep)Level 9. God of WisdomAnswered on 06 Jun 2019Yes as long as you have more than 20k in your OA + SA Accounts. CPF Life will pay a pro rated amount, so if you set aside 65% of the FRS, you'll get about 65% of the payouts. You can use the CPF Life estimator calculator on the CPF website to have a look. Play around with the numbers. :)0 comments0
